intro: Hackelia floribunda, commonly known as scarlet gilia, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the western United States. It features slender, upright stems that bear clusters of bright red, spurred flowers, which are characteristic of the Scrophulariaceae family. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are opposite and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in dry slopes and rocky areas. Its showy flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, making it a valuable addition to native plant gardens.
